name: The Villa Paradiso

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here on two separate legs of our 21 day vacation in Cambodia. Everything about it was outstanding including the rooms, pool, food, and lastly but certainly not least, the staff. They were always there to make sure that guests were well taken care of, and with always a very happy and sincere smile. We stayed in the Colonial Garden Room, it was beautiful, spacious, and quiet. Food is good too, in fact we rarely left for dinner. Have to try their Margarita pizza, best I ever had, even in the US. Villa Paradiso will be the first on the list when we return to Cambodia someday.
reviews.title: Fabulous, Tranquil Oasis in Phnom Penh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed at the villa paradiso when we first arrived in phnom penh,the reviews couldn't do this place justice.it is absolutely beautiful with the most professional staff i have seen in all of Cambodia which says alot as service in cambodia is a very high step above western customs.our first visit lasted four days then we left to travel the country and onward to Vietnam .we arrived back in Phnom penh 7 weeks later and with out hesitation we were back at the paradiso villa.incase you haven't been to phnom before it can be quite overwhelming at times and the paradisso is exactly what it says it is an oasis in the heart of the city.also we found the food to be among the best in cambodia , i was dreaming about my aussie peppered steak for the whole 7 weeks i was gone lol sorry but myself and my wife did not haave the opportunity to take advantage of their spa package so no info there but im sure it would compare to the rest of their services which i rate as excellent!
reviews.title: already planning our third stay there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Villa Paradiso is an excellent, quaint boutique hotel in a good location in Phnom Penh. The staff were very helpful and the owners were often on hand to help with anything needed. They decorated each room with a different theme and they were beautifully and individually unique. It is a small place where visitors can gather for breakfast in a little gazebo, making it feel more homey.
reviews.title: Excellent Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definitely recommend it to anyone heading to Phnom Penh.
reviews.title: Excellent in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed there based on Tripadvisor rating and were not disappointed. This is a boutique hotel and so forget about the porter in uniform,although we did get a welcome drink on arrival. Our booking was very much last minute but they were patient and helpful with the booking. All the staff we spoke with (and certainly reception and restaurant) all spoke good English and were most helpfu and pleasant. Taxis etc were arranged by reception and arrived promptly, clean taxis with good English. The pool area was fine, the restaurant / bar is good and the food cooked fresh for every order, even breakfast. No buffets and cold food sitting in bain marie at 7.30am! My wife had a spa and massage and said it was good. The 20 minute wait for hot water is very over-stated, I found the water went to really hot in about 3 to 5 minutes, which given that the toilet is in the bathroom, gave me more than enough time to attend to other needs before my shower!
reviews.title: The good, the disappointing and unfortunately the bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only had one night at the Villa Paradiso, and I had booked us in the suite - Phnom Penh was our stopover between Siem Reap and Ho Chi Minh City. The hotel was clean and our suite was amazing. They were able to arrange bus bookings on the Mekong Express to Vietnam (and arranged for the bus to pick us up at the hotel so we didn't have to find separate transport to the bus station!) Breakfast was great - I wish we had more time to use the very picturesque pool!
reviews.title: One night at Villa Paradiso

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I are from Perth Australia and this was our second trip to Phnom Penh. Our initial thoughts are to go to the likes of a Sheraton or similar but we thought we'd try something a bit different.
reviews.title: Well Managed, Fun, Boutique, Great Food, Oasis of Relaxation in a Crazy City!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: We were rewarded! It's better than staying at the big name and high turnover hotels becuase it really feels like a home away from home without missing out on the service you like to get on holidays.
reviews.title: Keep Returning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: Our impression at the outset was the place is well managed and this was confirmed time and again throughout our stay. The staff know their job well and are prompt with their service.
reviews.title: Highly recommend this property for the traveller seeking a quiet relaxing space.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food is fantastic. Authentic European cooking by way of pizzas and fresh baguettes. Yum.
reviews.title: Top Drawer - no hesitation in recommending this place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I couldn't fault the staff, they were lovely and attentive and very helpful in sourcing transport etc.
reviews.title: I expected more given the rating though couldn't fault the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately the hotel did not live up to expectations - a little too minimalist (despite a very comfortable bed). Balinese lounging platform was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Great, great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: TV was very difficult to use and the water for the shower had to be turned on with a button 20mins before wanting to shower. Fair enough, Cambodia is a developing country, though if the hotel is to charge similar prices to 5star they need to add a few more finishing touches and have a little more attention to detail.
reviews.title: Absolutely great place to stay when visiting Phnom Penh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a faultlessly brilliant small and charming hotel. Great location, friendly and professional staff, beautiful, spacious, tasteful and well-equipped rooms, a lovely pool and restaurant area, good food and drinks, and a great spa. The best of six hotels we stayed in on our trip - first class.
reviews.title: Simply the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Being in Thailand on holiday already we decided to also visit Cambodia and as such when searching did find The Villa Paradiso and booked a last minute stay of 3 days. Starting with the communication and all aspects of our stay we have been extremely happy having selected The Villa Paradiso. Well run, warm welcomed, all staff extremely helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Wonderful - Loved It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Villa Paradiso is a lovely charming hotel located in a very nice part of town. The hotel is a lovely old mansion that has been converted. Although the grounds are not that big it still does manage to utilize space very well and has a lovely swimming pool. We stayed at the Colonial Garden View Room which was pretty spacious with a nice four poster bed. The bathroom was also very spacious. The bathroom had a large tub area which very spacious but took ages to fill and the hot water ran out whenever we tried to fill it. The service was very good right from booking till we checked in and checked out.The breakfast was nice but limited in choice compared to other hotels. The breakfast / lunch / dinner area was nice and cosy though and gave a very homely feel. Added advantage was the wifi which was very nice. Would recommend this hotel and we would stay there again on our trip back to Phnom Penh.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Phnom Penh is crazy and i highly reccomend it.. If you are coming to Phnom Penh the i Highly reccomend this hotel. My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights and thought this hotel was beautiful... Sandra the owner was very welcoming, and suggested very good resturants, the day staff in the resturant/bar were amazing and so so so helpful,,, every aspect of the experience over exceeded our expectations, I would reccomend to anyone coming to Phnom Penh. Beauiful pool, jacuzzi and spa treatments were top class!
reviews.title: Sanctuary in a bustling city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great location owners and staff work hard at making this a good experience.
reviews.title: Great find definitely come back happy to recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a very short visit for us but we would love to come back,also a place we would be happy to recommend to our friends. It is a real "haven" and sometimes in Phnom Penh a place like this is almost "heaven".
reviews.title: Very Classy Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We are returning to Cambodia to do some voluntary work and the owners were very happy to help with useful and helpful info.
reviews.title: Superb boutique hotel, friendly, relaxed

aka: The Villa Paradiso Hotel Phnom Penh
description: This real gem, in the center of Phnom Penh, was the brainchild of Sandra and Philipp, two passionate travelers whose aim was to create a boutique hotel which would capture for guests the essence of some of their wonderful trips around the globe.Extensive renovations to a charming Khmer villa, carried out to the highest standards, ensure that guests receive, for a very affordable price, the services of a 5 star hotel accompanied by warm hospitality and personalized attention, which ranks among the best in Phnom Penh.A fusion of exotic Asia with modern amenities has given to each of the ten rooms its own very special character. With furnishings collected from around the world and individually designed modern bathrooms, guests can enjoy the very best in ambiance and comfort.With its location on a quiet residential street in the center of Phnom Penh, the hotel is within easy reach of tourist attractions like the royal palace and is just a few blocks from an enormous choice of restaurants and bars. Click here for exact location.After a day of sightseeing or getting business done, guests can relax in a lush tropical garden by the pool, pamper themselves in the spa, unwind in the Jacuzzi, detox in the sauna, and enjoy an assortment of healthy snacks, wonderful cakes and fresh fruit juices at the garden café.
